intro: Versteegia puberula, commonly known as the silky versteegia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its soft, hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant, white or pink flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
